roleset.name: measure the time it takes to do an action, measuring time it takes

example.name: time-v: passive-- just like John
example.text: [John]-2 ran the Boston Marathon last week, and *trace*-2 was timed at one week, three days, four hours, sixteen minutes and 27 seconds, his best performance yet.
example.arg: at one week, three days, four hours, sixteen minutes and 27 seconds,

roleset.note: TIME-V NOTES: Member of Vncls register-54.1. VN, FN updated by Julia 10/2010. (from time.01-v)

roleset.name: synchronize

example.name: time-v: merged things
example.text: Totally absorbed, the ringers stare straight ahead, using peripheral vision (they call it ``rope-sight'') to watch the other ropes and thus time their pulls.

example.name: time-v: second thing, sorta
example.text: Renaissance declined to confirm the move, but [its stock purchases]-1 were thought to have begun Tuesday, timed *trace*-1 to coincide with the maturity this week of Treasury bills owned by the firm.
example.arg: to coincide with the maturity this week of Treasury bills owned by the firm.

example.name: ARG1
example.text: The timing of Chinese New Year is determined by the traditional lunar calendar and marks an important transition , the point when Winter gives way to Spring .

roleset.note: TIME-V NOTES: Frames file for 'time' based on sentences in wsj. (from time.02-v predicate notes)

roleset.name: synchronize

example.name: timely-j
example.text: We must decide whether the petition was timely with respect to our review of a collection action pursuant to section 6330(d)(1)
example.arg: with respect to our review of a collection action pursuant to section 6330(d)(1)

roleset.note: TIMELY-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from timely.02-j)
